node.title: Space junk has forced NASA to temporarily postpone a spacewalk. So where did it come from?
node.description: NASA is forced to temporarily postponeÂ a spacewalk because of space junk that could puncture an astronaut's suit or damage the International Space Station.
node.content:
["NASA has been forced to temporarily postpone\u00a0a spacewalk because of space junk that could puncture an astronaut's suit or damage the International Space Station (ISS).", "Two US\u00a0astronauts were set to replace a bad antenna outside of the ISS when\u00a0mission control learned that a piece of orbiting debris could come dangerously close.", "There wasn't enough time to assess the threat, so station managers delayed the spacewalk until Thursday.", "
Fears debris could collide with ISS
", "Astronauts Tom Marshburn and Kayla Barron were due to venture outside the space station on Tuesday morning (local time), despite what NASA officials acknowledged was a slightly elevated risk level from debris scattered in low-Earth orbit by a Russian anti-satellite missile test.", "Their objective was\u00a0to remove a faulty S-band radio communications antenna assembly, now more than 20 years old, and replace it with a new spare stowed outside the ISS.", "But about five hours before the outing was to have begun, the National Aeronautics and Space Administration made a surprise announcement.", "Mission control had been alerted that the US military's Space Surveillance Network had detected debris that could collide with the ISS, and the spacewalk was called off.", "Later that day, NASA said its evaluation of the situation \"determined the orbit of the debris does not pose a risk to a scheduled spacewalk\" or ISS operations, and the\u00a0antenna repair was rescheduled for Thursday.", "
So where did the debris come from?
", "The origin of the debris was not made clear in the\u00a0NASA\u00a0announcement.", "A NASA spokesman, Gary Jordan, said there was no information available about the size of the debris, its proximity to the ISS, which is orbiting about 402 kilometres above the Earth, or whether one or more objects were involved.", "Last month,\u00a0astronauts working on the ISS were woken up and told to take shelter after Russia fired a missile into one of its own defunct satellites in an unannounced space weapons test.", "But while the residual debris cloud from the blasted satellite has since dispersed,\u00a0NASA calculates that remaining fragments continue to pose a \"slightly elevated\" background risk to the orbiting platform as a whole.", "Dana Weigel, NASA's deputy manager of the space station program, told reporters there was a 7 per cent higher risk\u00a0of spacewalkers' suits being punctured, as compared to before Russia's missile test.", "However, Mr Jordan said they had \"no indications\" the most recent incident was related to the Russian missile test.", "
Has anything like this happened before?
", "Yep.", "There have been about 30 close encounters with orbital debris requiring\u00a0\"evasive action\" over the ISS's 23-year lifetime, The Conversation reports.", "", "
Earlier this year, a piece of space junk damaged the orbiting lab's robotic arm.(Supplied: Canadian Space Agency)
", "Three of those occurred in 2020, and earlier this year,\u00a0a\u00a0piece of space junk damaged the orbiting lab's robotic arm.", "While over 23,000 objects the size of a softball or larger are tracked around the clock to detect potential collisions with satellites and the ISS, it was not immediately clear what caused the impact.", "ABC/wires"]
